intro: Mariscus kraussii, commonly known as the Cape honeysuckle, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of about 1 to 2 meters, featuring opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular, yellow flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and birds. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for coastal and sandy environments. The genus Mariscus is part of the family Rubiaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with similar characteristics.
